alert.note: Alert for Athens; Gallia; Jackson; Meigs; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 8:13AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Meigs, northeastern Gallia, southern Jackson, southeastern Vinton, southeastern Athens, west central Ritchie, northwestern Mason, northwestern Wirt, north central Jackson and Wood Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 812 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Washington to near Oak Hill. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Pomeroy, Racine, Coolville, Rutland, Forked Run State Park, New Haven, Mason, Washington, Mineralwells, North Bend State Park, Tuppers Plains, Lubeck, Middleport, Chester, Syracuse, Hartford City, Cairo, Vinton and Wilkesville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 159 and 175. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 8, and between mile markers 12 and 19, and near mile marker 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
